Electric Eyrie.Setup0: Form a supply of 20 warriors near you.
Electric Eyrie.Setup1: Place 1 roost and 6 warriors in the corner clearing diagonally opposite from the clearing with the keep token. If the Marquise is not playing, place those pieces in a random corner clearing.
Electric Eyrie.Setup3: Collect your remaining 6 roost buildings and place them near you.

Vagabot.Setup0: Place the Vagabot pawn in the forest adjacent to the most clearings. If there are multiple such forests, decide randomly among those.
Vagabot.Setup1: Shuffle the quest deck, draw 1 quest card, and place it face up near you. This quest can only be completed by the bot.
Vagabot.Setup2: Place any 1 item marked "R" beneath each ruin on the map.
Vagabot.Setup3: Take any 4 items marked "S" and place them in your Satchel. _(The Tinker starts with 3 items instead of 4 items.)_

Automated Alliance.Setup0: Form a supply of 10 warriors near you.
Automated Alliance.Setup1: Collect your 3 bases and place them near you.
Automated Alliance.Setup2: Collect your 10 sympathy tokens and place them near you.

Mechanical Marquise.Setup0: Form a supply of 25 warriors near you.
Mechanical Marquise.Setup1: Place the keep token in a random corner clearing.
Mechanical Marquise.Setup2: Place a warrior in each clearing, except the corner clearing diagonally opposite from the keep. Place an extra warrior in the clearing with the keep token. _(Place 12 warriors in total.)_
Mechanical Marquise.Setup3: Place 1 sawmill, 1 workshop and 1 recruiter randomly among the clearing with the keep token and those clearings adjacent with up to one building per clearing.
Mechanical Marquise.Setup4: Collect your remaining 15 buildings and place them near you.

Electric Eyrie (DC).Setup0: Form a supply of 20 warriors near you.
Electric Eyrie (DC).Setup1: Place 1 roost and 6 warriors in the corner clearing diagonally opposite from the clearing with the keep token. If the Marquise is not playing, place those pieces in a random corner clearing.
Electric Eyrie (DC).Setup3: Collect your remaining 6 roost buildings and place them near you.

Vagabot (DC).Setup1: Shuffle the quest deck, draw 1 quest card, and place it face up near you. This quest can only be completed by the bot.
Vagabot (DC).Setup2: Place any 1 item marked "R" beneath each ruin on the map.
Vagabot (DC).Setup3: Take any 4 items marked "S" and place them in your Satchel. _(The Tinker starts with 3 items instead of 4 items.)_

Automated Alliance (DC).Setup2: Collect your 10 sympathy tokens and place them near you.

Mechanical Marquise (DC).Setup2: Place a warrior in each clearing, except the corner clearing diagonally opposite from the keep. Place an extra warrior in the clearing with the keep token. _(Place 12 warriors in total.)_
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Setup3: Place 1 sawmill, 1 workshop and 1 recruiter randomly among the clearings adjacent to the clearing with the keep token with up to one building per clearing.

Cogwheel Corvids.Setup0: Form supplies of 15 warriors and 8 plot tokens face down.
Cogwheel Corvids.Setup1: Place 1 Warrior in the lowest priority clearing of each suit (3 total).

Drillbit Duchy.Setup0: Form supplies of 20 warriors, 3 tunnel tokens, and 9 crowns.
Drillbit Duchy.Setup1: Place the Burrow board near the map.
Drillbit Duchy.Setup2: Place 2 warriors and 1 tunnel in a corner clearing that is not the starting corner clearing. Then place 2 warriors in each clearing adjacent to the chosen corner clearing, except the Burrow.
Drillbit Duchy.Setup3: Place 3 citadels and 3 markets on your matching Building spaces.
Drillbit Duchy.Setup4: Draw 2 cards and discard them. For each, place a crown on the topmost matching unswayed minister on your faction board.

Logical Lizards.Setup1: Place 4 warriors and 1 garden of matching printed suit in a random corner clearing that is not the starting corner clearing of another bot (preferably diagonally opposite.) Then place 1 warrior in each adjacent clearing.
Logical Lizards.Setup2: Place the outcast marker on the Sanctify space of the Conspiracy track on your faction board.
Logical Lizards.Setup3: Place your 14 remaining gardens on the matching spaces of your Gardens tracks from right to left.
Logical Lizards.Setup4: Draw 3 cards and place them face up in your Lost Souls in the order drawn.

Riverfolk Robots.Setup1: Place 1 warrior in each clearing on the river.
Riverfolk Robots.Setup2: Place 9 trade posts on the matching spaces of your Trade Posts tracks.
Riverfolk Robots.Setup3: Place 1 warrior in your Payments box.
Riverfolk Robots.Setup4: Draw 5 cards and add them to your Market.

Electric Eyrie.Easy: During setup, add only one Loyal Vizier to the Decree.
Electric Eyrie.Challenging: During setup, take one bird Ambush from the deck and add it to the bird column of the Decree.
Electric Eyrie.Nightmare: During setup, take one bird Ambush from the deck and add it to the bird column of the Decree. At the end of Evening, score one victory point.

Vagabot.Easy: In evening, refresh one fewer item.
Vagabot.Challenging: In evening, refresh one more item.
Vagabot.Nightmare: In evening, refresh one more item. At the end of Evening, score one victory point.

Automated Alliance.Easy: You only **Organize** if a clearing has four or more Alliance warriors.
Automated Alliance.Challenging: You **Organize** if a clearing has two or more Alliance warriors.
Automated Alliance.Nightmare: You **Organize** if a clearing has two or more Alliance warriors. At the end of Evening, score one victory point.

Mechanical Marquise.Challenging: Whenever you **Recruit**, also place two warriors in the ordered clearing you rule of highest priority.
Mechanical Marquise.Nightmare: Whenever you **Recruit**, also place two warriors in the ordered clearing you rule of highest priority. At the end of Evening, score one victory point.

Electric Eyrie (DC).Easy: Whenever you **Recruit** for bird, instead place one fewer warrior.
Electric Eyrie (DC).Challenging: Whenever you **Recruit** for bird, instead place one more warrior.
Electric Eyrie (DC).Nightmare: Whenever you **Recruit** for bird, instead place one more warrior. At the end of Evening, score one victory point per two players (rounded up).

Vagabot (DC).Nightmare: In evening, refresh one more item. At the end of Evening, score one victory point per two players (rounded up).

Automated Alliance (DC).Challenging: You **Organize** if a clearing has two or more Alliance warriors.
Automated Alliance (DC).Nightmare: You **Organize** if a clearing has two or more Alliance warriors. At the end of Evening, score one victory point per two players (rounded up).

Mechanical Marquise (DC).Easy: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead place only three warriors.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Challenging: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead place five warriors.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Nightmare: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead place five warriors. At the end of Evening, score one victory point per two players (rounded up).

Cogwheel Corvids.Easy: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead place only one warrior in each of two ordered clearings.
Cogwheel Corvids.Normal: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead place two warriors in each of two ordered clearings.
Cogwheel Corvids.Challenging: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead place three warriors in each of two ordered clearings.
Cogwheel Corvids.Nightmare: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead place three warriors in each of two ordered clearings. At the end of Evening, score one victory point per two players (rounded up).

Drillbit Duchy.Easy: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead recruit only one warrior, plus one per mole showing, into the burrow.
Drillbit Duchy.Normal: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead recruit two warriors, plus one per mole showing, into the burrow.
Drillbit Duchy.Challenging: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead recruit three warriors, plus one per mole showing, into the burrow.
Drillbit Duchy.Nightmare: Whenever you **Recruit**, instead recruit three warriors, plus one per mole showing, into the burrow. At the end of Evening, score one victory point per two players (rounded up).

Logical Lizards.Easy: Whenever you perform **Rituals**, reveal only three cards from your Lost Souls.
Logical Lizards.Normal: Whenever you perform **Rituals**, reveal only four cards from your Lost Souls.
Logical Lizards.Challenging: Whenever you perform **Rituals**, reveal five cards from your Lost Souls.
Logical Lizards.Nightmare: Whenever you perform **Rituals**, reveal five cards from your Lost Souls. At the end of Evening, score one victory point per two players (rounded up).

Riverfolk Robots.Easy: Whenever you **Build and Garrison**, place no warrior at the trade post.
Riverfolk Robots.Normal: Whenever you **Build and Garrison**, place one warrior at the trade post.
Riverfolk Robots.Challenging: Whenever you **Build and Garrison**, place two warriors at the trade post.
Riverfolk Robots.Nightmare: Whenever you **Build and Garrison**, place two warriors at the trade post. At the end of Evening, score one victory point per two players (rounded up).

SpecificRules.TextPoorManualDexterity: You have no hand of cards. You cannot discard cards. If a human would take a card from you, they draw a card instead. If a human would give a card to you, they discard it, and you score **vp:1**.
SpecificRules.TextHatesSurprises: Ambush cards cannot be played against you.
SpecificRules.TextLordsOfTheForest: You rule any clearings where you are tied in presence.
SpecificRules.TextNobility: You now fall into turmoil if you cannot place a roost or a warrior. Whenever you fall into turmoil, you do not lose victory points. Instead, you score one victory point per bird card in the Decree.
SpecificRules.TextRelentless: After resolving the Decree, remove all defenseless buildings and tokens in any clearing with Eyrie warriors.
SpecificRules.TextSwoop: At the end of Daylight, place two warriors in the clearing of highest priority with no Eyrie pieces.
SpecificRules.TextWarTax: Whenever you remove an enemy building or token, its owner loses one victory point.
SpecificRules.TextLoneWanderer: Your pawn is not a warrior and cannot be removed from the map.
SpecificRules.TextNimble: You can move regardless of who rules your clearing.
SpecificRules.TextAdventurer:
You can **Battle** no more than once per turn.
At the end of Daylight, repeat **Quest** as many times as possible.
SpecificRules.TextBerserker:
Whenever you **Battle**, instead move to the nearest clearing with the most pieces and target the player with the most pieces there.
In evening, repair one more item.
SpecificRules.TextHelper: Whenever you **Aid**, score one extra victory point, and the aided player draws two cards instead of one.
SpecificRules.TextHelperDC: Whenever you **Aid**, if there are no available items, move to aid the player with the lowest score, and exhaust one item to score **vp:1**. The aided player draws one card.
SpecificRules.TextMarksman: At the start of battle as attacker, deal an immediate hit _(scoring a point if you remove an enemy warrior)_.
SpecificRules.TextAutomatedAmbush: In battle as defender with any Alliance warriors, you deal an extra hit.
SpecificRules.TextAutomatedOutrage: Whenever a human removes a sympathy token or moves any warriors into a sympathetic clearing, they must discard a matching card. If they cannot, you score **vp:1**.
SpecificRules.TextMartialLaw: Whenever you place a sympathy token in a clearing with three or more warriors of an enemy player, you score one fewer victory point _(minimum of zero)_.
SpecificRules.TextCrackdown: Whenever a base is removed, remove all sympathy tokens from clearings matching the suit of the base removed.
SpecificRules.TextCrackdownDC: Whenever a base is removed, return all sympathy tokens from clearings matching the suit of the base removed.
SpecificRules.TextInformants: Defenseless sympathy tokens benefit from Automated Ambush.
SpecificRules.TextPopularity: Enemies do not score victory points for removing sympathy tokens.
SpecificRules.TextPopularityDC: Enemies can only score one victory point per turn for removing your sympathy tokens.
SpecificRules.TextVeterans: Gain the Guerilla Warfare ability of the Woodland Alliance. _(In battle as defender, you use the higher roll and the attacker uses the lower roll.)_
SpecificRules.TextVeteransDC: In battle as defender, use the same die result as the attacker. _(Both players use the higher die to determine hits rolled.)_
SpecificRules.TextWildfire: At the end of evening, **Spread Sympathy**. Do not score points for placing this sympathy token.
SpecificRules.TextTheKeep: Only you can place pieces in the clearing with the keep token.
SpecificRules.TextBlitz: After you move, find the clearing you rule of the highest priority without any enemy pieces. Move all but one warrior from the clearing. Then, battle in the destination clearing.
SpecificRules.TextFortified: Your buildings each take two hits to remove. Taking a single hit with a building has no effect.
SpecificRules.TextHospitals: At the end of battle as defender, if two or more Marquise warriors were removed in the battle, place two warriors in the clearing with the keep token.
SpecificRules.TextHospitalsDC: At the end of battle as defender, if two or more Marquise warriors were removed in the battle, place one warrior in the clearing with the keep token.
SpecificRules.TextIronWill: Whenever you **Recruit** in Escalated Daylight, place double the warriors.
SpecificRules.TextIronWillDC: **Repeat Daylight** may happen twice per turn instead of only once.
SpecificRules.TextEmbeddedAgents: In battle as defender with a facedown plot token, you deal an extra hit.
SpecificRules.TextBackupPlans: Whenever a plot token is removed, place a warrior in the clearing from which the plot was removed.
SpecificRules.TextVendetta: Whenever any plot token is flipped, it has the When Flipped effect of a Bomb plot.
SpecificRules.TextGamble: Whenever a plot would be flipped, the human with the most faction pieces in the clearing must first guess the plot type. If they're correct, the plot flips and scores, but does not resolve its When Flipped effect. Then they remove the plot (scoring a point). If they're incorrect, you score +1 Victory Point.
SpecificRules.TextCostOfErrors: Whenever any number of Duchy buildings are removed, remove the crown from the bottommost swayed minister.
SpecificRules.TextFoundations: Whenever **Cost of Errors** triggers, it now removes the crown from the bottommost swayed minister whose suit matches a clearing from which a building was removed.
SpecificRules.TextInvestors: Whenever a human triggers **Cost of Errors**, they must discard a card that matches a clearing from which a Duchy building was removed. If they discard a matching card, the Duchy loses one victory point. If they cannot, the Duchy sways a minister, as in the sway action, but the minister must also match a clearing of removal
SpecificRules.TextInvaders: The clearing tie for the dig action is now 'such a clearing that has the most enemy buildings, then the fewest enemy warriors.' If you cannot build because no building slots are open, battle in each clearing instead.
SpecificRules.TextOverwhelm: You now **Dig** twice per turn, and it now requires and moves only three warriors (not four.)
SpecificRules.TextPilgrims: You rule clearings that have a garden.
SpecificRules.TextRobotRevenge: Whenever any Lizard warriors are removed outside your turn, place one of them in your Acolytes box.
SpecificRules.TextFanatics: Whenever you **Convert**, battle in that clearing after converting the warrior. In this battle deal an extra hit. * **Player Tie:** Target player with most defenseless buildings, then most points.*.
SpecificRules.TextMartyrs: Whenever you perform a bird ritual, also place a warrior from your supply into your Acolytes box.
SpecificRules.TextErratic: At the end of your turn, draw a card and add it to your Lost Souls.
SpecificRules.TextSpiteful: Whenever you **Crusade** score one extra victory point if you remove any tokens.
SpecificRules.TextMarket: The market is a row of face-up cards, the order of its cards cannot change.
SpecificRules.TextGarrison: As defender in battle, you are never defenseless, and your trade posts each add one to your maximum rolled hits.
SpecificRules.TextGreedy: Score +1 victory point whenever the player with the most points buys any number of your services.
SpecificRules.TextFerocious: As attacker in battle, your maximum rolled hits is always three.
SpecificRules.TextInvolved: If a human does not buy your Mercenaries service on their turn, treat your warriors as if all of that player's enemies bought Mercenaries. The Vagabond can buy Mercenaries to avoid this penalty but does not benefit from the service.

Vagabot.CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Vagabot.RestOrder: If you have two or fewer undamaged items, move to a random adjacent forest, then go to Evening.

Automated Alliance.Revolt: Remove all enemy pieces from the **card:{{suit}}** sympathetic clearing with the most enemy pieces, and place the **card:{{suit}}** base there.
Automated Alliance.RevoltSpread: If you did not revolt, **Spread Sympathy** {{sympathySpread}}.

Cogwheel Corvids.CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Cogwheel Corvids.RecruitOrder: **Recruit** two warriors in each of two **card:{{suit}}** clearings. (Priority to clearings without plot tokens then with most Corvid warriors.)
Cogwheel Corvids.Flip: **Flip** each plot token (no warrior required). Each time you flip a plot, score +1 victory point per face-up plot on the map, then resolve its When Flipped effect if any.

Drillbit Duchy.CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Drillbit Duchy.RecruitOrder: **Recruit** two warriors, plus one per mole showing, in the burrow (remember Foremole.)

Logical Lizards.Outcasts: The most common suit in your Los Souls is the order. On a tie, the order is bird.

Riverfolk Robots.StockMarket: Draw two cards and add them to the Market's right side until it has five.
Riverfolk Robots.CraftOrder: Craft the first card added to the Market that shows an available item for **vp:1** and then discard it.
Riverfolk Robots.SetOrder: Set order to be the rightmost Market Card.

Electric Eyrie.Recruit:
Recruit {{totalForSuit}} warrior(s) in a {{suitText}} clearing with a roost. {{recruitText}}
_(**Ties**: Recruit in such a clearing with the most enemy pieces, then fewest Eyrie warriors, then lowest priority.)_
Electric Eyrie.Move:
Move from the {{suitText}} clearing you rule with the most of your warriors to an adjacent clearing. Leave enough warriors to exactly rule the origin clearing or {{totalForSuit}}, whichever is higher.
_(**Destination Ties**: Move to such a clearing with no roost, then fewest enemy pieces, then lowest priority.)_
Electric Eyrie.Battle:
Battle in a {{suitText}} clearing against the player with the most buildings there. {{extraHit}}
_(**Clearing Ties**: Battle in such a clearing with no roost, then most defenseless buildings, then lowest priority.)_
_(**Defender Ties**: Battle such a player with the most pieces there, then the player with the most victory points.)_
Electric Eyrie.ExtraDecree: You should have added at least 2 bird cards to the decree.
Electric Eyrie.ExtraRelentless: Remove all defenseless tokens and buildings in any clearing with Eyrie warriors.
Electric Eyrie.ExtraRecruit: If you cannot place a warrior, you fall into turmoil.
Electric Eyrie.ExtraBuild: Place a roost in the clearing you rule of highest priority with no roost. If you cannot place a roost, you fall into turmoil.
Electric Eyrie.ExtraSwoop: Place two warriors in the clearing of highest priority with no Eyrie pieces.

Vagabot.ActionExplore: Move to the nearest ruin, exhausting one item per move, then exhaust one item to take an item from that ruin.
Vagabot.ActionQuest: Move to the nearest clearing matching the quest, then exhaust any two items to discard the quest and score **vp:1**. _(Ignore card text.)_ Then, replace the quest.
Vagabot.ActionQuestRepeat: Repeat this as many times as possible.
Vagabot.ActionAid: Target the player in your clearing with any items and the least VP among those players. Exhaust as many items as possible up to the number of items they have, take that many items from them, and score {{aidHelpText}}that many VP. Then, they draw {{aidHelpText}}that many cards.
Vagabot.ActionBattle: Move to the nearest clearing with any pieces of the enemy with the most {{target}}, then exhaust one item to battle that player. Score **vp:1** per enemy warrior removed.
Vagabot.ActionBattleAdventurer: Repeat this action, exhausting two items per extra battle, as many times as possible.
Vagabot.ActionBattleMarksman: Deal an immediate hit in each battle.
Vagabot.ActionBattleTiebreaker: _(If target defender is in multiple clearings at equal distance, move to clearing where they have most buildings and tokens, then fewest warriors.)_
Vagabot.ActionRepair: If you have any damaged items, exhaust one item to repair one damaged item, unexhausted before exhausted.
Vagabot.ActionSpecial: Exhaust one item to do the following (skip if it would have no effect):

Automated Alliance.Sympathy:
Place a sympathy token in the **card:{{suit}}** clearing with the fewest enemy warriors adjacent to any sympathetic clearing.
(**No Such Clearings**: Instead place a sympathy token on the clearing with the fewest enemy pieces.)
(**Cannot Spread**: If you cannot place a sympathy token, score 5 VP.)
Automated Alliance.Revolt: Remove all enemy pieces from any sympathetic clearing with the most enemy pieces, and place the corresponding base there.

Mechanical Marquise.Blitz: Find the clearing you rule of the highest priority without any enemy pieces. Move all but one warrior from the clearing. Then, battle in the destination clearing.
Mechanical Marquise.Bird0: Battle in all clearings. _(Defender is the player with most pieces, then victory points.)_
Mechanical Marquise.Bird1: Recruit {{warriorsOverTwo}} warrior(s) in each of the two clearings you rule with lowest priority. If you only rule one clearing, place all {{totalWarriors}} warriors there.
Mechanical Marquise.Bird2:
Build a building of the type with the most pieces on the map in a clearing you rule with the most Marquise Warriors.
_(On a tie between sawmills and any other building types, place a sawmill. On a tie between workshops and recruiters but not sawmills, place a recruiter.)_
Mechanical Marquise.Bird3: Move all but three of your warriors from each clearing to the adjacent clearing with the most enemy pieces. Then battle in each clearing you moved into.
Mechanical Marquise.BirdChallenging: Place two warriors in the ordered clearing you rule of the highest priority.
Mechanical Marquise.Suit0: Battle in each **card:{{suit}}** clearing. _(Defender is the player with most pieces, then victory points.)_
Mechanical Marquise.Suit1: Recruit {{totalWarriors}} warriors evenly spread across **card:{{suit}}** clearings you rule. If there are extra warriors that cannot be placed evenly in **card:{{suit}}** clearings, place the last warrior in the **card:{{suit}}** clearing with the highest priority.
Mechanical Marquise.Suit2: Build a **building:{{building}}** in a clearing you rule with the most Marquise warriors.
Mechanical Marquise.Suit3: Move all but three of your warriors from each **card:{{suit}}** clearing to the adjacent clearing with the most enemy pieces.
Mechanical Marquise.Repeat: If you did not place a building this turn and have five or fewer buildings on the map, discard the order card, draw a new one, and repeat Daylight.

Mechanical Marquise (DC).Suit1:
Recruit {{totalWarriors}} warriors evenly spread across **card:{{suit}}** clearings you rule. Score **vp:1** for every two warriors that could not be recruited.
_(**Clearing tie**: Place warriors into clearings with highest priority first.)_
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Suit2: Build a **building:{{building}}** in a clearing you rule with the most Marquise warriors.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Suit3: Move all but three of your warriors from each **card:{{suit}}** clearing to the adjacent clearing with the most enemy pieces. Each warrior may only move once during this action.

Cogwheel Corvids.Battle: **Battle** in each of two **card:{{suit}}** clearings. (Defender Tie: Player with the most buildings and tokens there, then with the most points.)
Cogwheel Corvids.Move: **Move** all but two warriors from each **card:{{suit}}** clearing with a face-up plot to an adjacent clearing with no plot. (Clearing Tie: Most Corvid Warriors.) (No Such Destination: Lowest Priority Clearing.)
Cogwheel Corvids.Plot: In the **card:{{suit}}** clearing with the most Corvid warriors and no plot, remove one Corvid warrior there to place a random facedown plot there.
Cogwheel Corvids.PlotThickens: In a clearing that has no plot and three or more Corvid warriors, remove a Corvid warrior from there to place a random facedown plot there. (Clearing Tie: Most Corvid Warriors.)

Drillbit Duchy.Dig: If the Burrow has four or more warriors, place a tunnel in a **card:{{suit}}** clearing with no runnel and no Duchy buildings. Also move four warriors from the burrow to the tunnel.
Drillbit Duchy.Battle: **Battle** in each **card:{{suit}}** clearing. (Defender Tie: Player with the most buildings, then the most pieces, then the most points.)
Drillbit Duchy.Build: **Build** in the clearing you rule with the most Duchy warriors. Place a citadel if you have 9+ warriors in your supply. Otherwise, place a market. Score **vp:1** if you cannot place a building while one is in supply.
Drillbit Duchy.Ministers: Take the actions of all your swayed ministers from top to bottom.

Logical Lizards.RitualsBird: Take a Lizard warrior from the clearing with the most Lizard warriors, place it in the Acolytes box. This card is discarded and is not placed in the Lost Souls pile.
Logical Lizards.RitualsOther: Place a warrior in a **card:{{suit}}** clearing. Then, if you rule that clearing, place a matching garden token there. (Clearing Tie: Place warrior in clearing with any open building slot, then most enemy buildings.)

Riverfolk Robots.BuildAndGarrison: Place a trade post and a warrior in an ordered clearing with no trade post. (Clearing Tie: Clearing with pieces of player who has the most warriors in payments.)
Riverfolk Robots.RecruitOther: **Recruit** one warrior in each **card:{{suit}}** clearing. (Not Enough Warriors: Place warriors on clearings with the highest priority.)
Riverfolk Robots.RecruitBird: **Recruit** one warrior in each clearing on the river. (Not Enough Warriors: Place warriors on clearings with the highest priority.)
Riverfolk Robots.Organize: If you have Protectionism: Score **vp:1** and place two warriors in a clearing that has Riverfolk pieces and the most enemy pieces..
Riverfolk Robots.BattleShield: Battle in each clearing. (Defender Tie: Player who has the fewest warriors in payments.)
Riverfolk Robots.BattleSword: Battle in each **card:{{suit}}** clearing. (Defender Tie: Player who has the fewest warriors in payments.)

Vagabot.Refresh: If you have any damaged items, refresh {{itemRefreshMin}} undamaged items. If you have none, refresh {{itemRefreshMax}} instead.
Vagabot.Forest: If you are in a forest, repair all items. If not, repair {{itemRepairs}} item(s). Repair unexhausted items before exhausted items.

Automated Alliance.Organize: In each clearing with a base and {{organizeVal}} or more Alliance warriors, remove all Alliance warriors there and **Spread Sympathy**.
Automated Alliance.WarriorPlace: Place a warrior in each clearing with a base.
Automated Alliance.Wildfire: **Spread Sympathy**, but do not score victory points.

Electric Eyrie (DC).NightmareScore: Score **vp:1** for every two players (rounded up).

Vagabot (DC).Refresh: Refresh {{itemRefreshMin}} items. If you have no damaged items, refresh {{itemRefreshMax}} instead.
Vagabot (DC).Forest: If you are in a forest, repair all items. If not, repair {{itemRepairs}} item(s). Repair unexhausted items before exhausted items.
Vagabot (DC).NightmareScore: Score **vp:1** for every two players (rounded up).

Automated Alliance (DC).Organize: In each clearing with a base and {{organizeVal}} or more Alliance warriors, remove all Alliance warriors there and **Spread Sympathy**.
Automated Alliance (DC).WarriorPlace: Place a warrior in each clearing with a base.
Automated Alliance (DC).Wildfire: **Spread Sympathy**, but do not score victory points.
Automated Alliance (DC).NightmareScore: Score **vp:1** for every two players (rounded up).

Mechanical Marquise (DC).Repeat: If you did not place a building this turn and would score less than 3 victory points, discard the order card, draw a new one, and repeat Daylight. This may only happen once per turn.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).RepeatIronWill: If you did not place a building this turn and have five or fewer buildings on the map, discard the order card, draw a new one, and repeat Daylight. This may only happen twice per turn.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).NightmareScore: Score **vp:1** for every two players (rounded up).

Drillbit Duchy.Rally: In each **card:{{suit}}** clearing with no Duchy buildings and two or fewer warriors, move all Duchy warriors to an adjacent clearing with a Duchy building. Then in each clearing you rule, place all but four Duchy warriors in the Burrow. (Target Clearing Tie: Fewest Duchy warriors.) (No Such Clearing: Place the warriors that would have moved in the Burrow.).
Drillbit Duchy.Score: Score **vp:1** per market on the map
Drillbit Duchy.Sway: Place a crown on the topmost ordered, unswayed, minister. (No Such Minister: Sway the bottommost unswayed minister.)

Logical Lizards.Score: Score **vp:1** worth the rightmost empty garden space.
Logical Lizards.ReturnRevealedCards: Return revealed cards to the top of your Lost Souls, preserving their previous order.
Logical Lizards.Craft: **Craft** the top card of the deck for **vp:1** if it shows an available item. Add it to your Lost Souls (not the discard.)

Riverfolk Robots.Score: Score **vp:1** per warrior of the player with the most warriors in Payments, then remove those warriors from Payments.
Riverfolk Robots.Racketeering: If Protectionism: From each clearing, take all but two Riverfolk warriors and place them in Payments.
Riverfolk Robots.Discard: Discard the leftmost card from the Market. If ProtectionismShield: Discard the leftmost card from the Market again.

Electric Eyrie.YesNobility: Score one victory point per bird card in the Decree.
Electric Eyrie.NoNobility: Lose one victory point per bird card in the Decree.

Vagabot.DescTinker: Search the discard pile for the top card with an available item and craft it, scoring **vp:1**. _Start the game with one fewer item._
Vagabot.SpecialTinker: Search the discard pile for the top card with an available item and craft it, scoring **vp:1**.
Vagabot.DescThief: Take a random card from the enemy in your clearing with most points there, then most pieces there.
Vagabot.SpecialThief: Take a random card from the enemy in your clearing with most points there, then most pieces there.
Vagabot.DescRanger: If you have three or more damaged items, slip into a random adjacent forest.
Vagabot.SpecialRanger: If you have three or more damaged items, slip into a random adjacent forest.
Vagabot.BattleTrack3: Maximum rolled hits: 3; as attacker, deal 1 extra hit.

Electric Eyrie (DC).YesNobility: Score one victory point per bird card in the Decree.
Electric Eyrie (DC).NoNobility: Lose one victory point per bird card in the Decree.

Vagabot (DC).DescTinker: Search the discard pile for the top card with an available item and craft it, gaining no points. _Start the game with one fewer item._
Vagabot (DC).SpecialTinker: Search the discard pile for the top card with an available item and craft it, gaining no points.
Vagabot (DC).DescThief: Take a random card from the enemy in your clearing with most points there, then most pieces there.
Vagabot (DC).SpecialThief: Take a random card from the enemy in your clearing with most points there, then most pieces there.
Vagabot (DC).DescRanger: If you have any damaged items, repair one damaged item, unexhausted before exhausted.
Vagabot (DC).SpecialRanger: If you have any damaged items, repair one damaged item, unexhausted before exhausted.
Vagabot (DC).BattleTrack3: Maximum rolled hits: 3; as attacker, deal 1 extra hit.

Ministers.Foremole: You have an additional revealed mole.
Ministers.Captain: As attacker in battle, deal an extra hit if the battle clearing has a tunnel.
Ministers.Marshal: Place a warrior into a clearing that has the fewest Duchy warriors and a Duchy building.
Ministers.Brigadier: Take the dig action if the Burrow has three or more warriors. For this dig action, use the Clearing Tie condition for a fox order.
Ministers.Mayor: Remove a Duchy warrior from the clearing you rule with the most Duchy warriors. If you do, score **vp:1**.
Ministers.Earl: Score **vp:1** per citadel on the map.
Ministers.Baron: Score **vp:1** per market on the map.
Ministers.Duchess: Score **vp:2** if all 3 tunnels are on the map.
